required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Conditional Financial Support on Pregnancy Outcomes in Pregnant Women With Low Incomes: Pragmatic Randomized Cluster Trial, With Parallel Arms

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to evaluate the impact of financial support on improving the management of prenatal care in pregnant women with low incomes. The judgment criterion is clinically pertinent: complications of pregnancy. This study also aims to evaluate attitudes to this approach through a qualitative survey.
It is planned to include 4000 women distributed into two arms of 2000 each. One group will receive financial support (prepaid payment card credited for each consultation attended according to the scheduled follow-up as recommended by the Haute Autorité de Santé); the other group will not. The management of the pregnancy for both groups will not be modified.

primary_outcome.measure: Occurence of complication(s) of pregnancy, wether maternal, fetal or neonatal
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay and for a maximum of one month after the term date.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal morbidity, mortality and rate of transfer of the newborn to a neonatal care unit.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay and for a maximum of one month after the term date.
secondary_outcome.description: A composite outcome measure consisting of multiple measures: neonatal morbidity, mortality and rate of tranfer of the newborn to a neonatal care unit

other_outcome.measure: Maternal morbidity, mortality and rate of caesarean sections
other_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay and for a maximum of one month after the term date.
other_outcome.description: A composite outcome measure consisting of multiple measures: maternal mobidity, mortality and rate og caesarean sections

other_outcome.measure: Number of scheduled consultations attended in agreement with the minimal follow-up recommendations of the Haute Autorité de Santé
other_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay and for a maximum of one month after the term date.

other_outcome.measure: Interview with a sociologist to evaluate perception of the intervention and evaluation of its perceived impact in follow-up of the pregnancy
Differential cost-effectiveness ratio associated with the financial support compared with the absence of support and expressed in terms of cost per complication avoided
other_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay and for a maximum of one month after the term date.

intervention.intervention_name: Delivery of a prepaid payment card
intervention.description: Delivery of a prepaid payment card credited according to consultations attended

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Age > 18 years
- 1st consultation before the 26th week of amenorrhea
- Recipient of free health care (Couverture Maladie Universelle, Couverture Maladie Universelle-Complémentaire)
- Who have provided written informed consent to take part in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Persons without national health insurance cover
- Persons unable to understand the information on the study, despite the help of a translator or a person of trust if necessary
- Persons under guardianship
